alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Lee; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:35AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Chatham, Lee and Wake. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of urban areas, rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 533 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cary, Sanford, Pittsboro, Garner, Fuquay-Varina, Goldston, Apex, Holly Springs, Morrisville, Broadway, Moncure, Seaforth Boat Dock, Jordan Lake State Rec Area, Shearon Harris Reservoir, Crosswinds Boating Center, Crosswinds Campground, Harris Lake Boat Launch and Bynum.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
